text: Hey John, yes it prints the names of the styles
How can I add a fields.json file directly in the design manager?
When you create a module or create a theme in the design manager the fields.json is automatically added.
So I copy/pasted the hubl and CSS from another theme, but I don’t have the fields in the new module. I’d rather not have to recreate them from scratch, what’s the best way to do it?

Well for one you can right click a module in the design manager to clone it.

If you’re using a marketplace theme, you can clone an item to the child theme.

Otherwise another way to do what you’re trying to do is use the HubSpot CLI:

Download the module, upload the module’s fields.json to the location of your new module. Done.

Similarly there is a Copy JSON feature in the design manager module editor over fields. You can then upload that json in a fields.json file for the module.

So lots of options depending on what works best for your workflow
